title: Pacific & Juan de Fuca Plate Boundaries
caption: There are divergent and transform fault boundaries between the Pacific Plate and the Juan de Fuca Plate off the northwestern United States.

title: Ocean Off of the Pacific Northwest
caption: The Coastal Endurance location is located in the ocean off of Oregon and Washington states. Some of the data in this activity were collected from the Central Oregon Line (highlighted in red). Other data in this activity were collected from various seismic instruments throughout the region operated by different government agencies (e.g., USGS) and universities (e.g., Oregon State University).

title: What it Looks Like Under the Water
caption: Below the ocean surface off of Oregon are multiple oceanographic instruments attached along cables running along the seafloor in the Coastal Endurance location. This is a drawing to represent where the different instruments are located in the ocean. Data in this activity were collected from Cabled Continental Margin (in the bottom right corner) and Cabled Axial Seamount (highlighted in the white box on the left).

title: What Collects the Seismic Data?
caption: Multiple Broadband Ocean Bottom Seismometers provide data to investigate seismicity/earthquake activity along tectonic plate boundaries where large-magnitude subduction zone earthquakes and seismicity associated with movement of magma beneath the seafloor at underwater volcanoes can occur. The Broadband Ocean Bottom Seismometers used at the OOI sites are Guralp, model CMG-1T/5T. More information about the instrument can be found at the Interactive Oceans Broadband Ocean Bottom Seismometer webpage.
